entries.meaning: An incentive that helps bring about a desired state. In some contexts, this can imply bribery.
examples: Citation of Richard Stallman ...it won't run on a free platform and (...) your program is actually an inducement for people to install non-free software.

entries.meaning: (law) An introductory statement of facts or background information.
(shipping) The act of placing a port on a vessel's itinerary because the volume of cargo offered at that port justifies the cost of routing the vessel.
